meta.content: Imagine Prep Superstition The College Prep School of the East Valley. Serving Students from Apache Junction, Mesa, Gilbert, Chandler, San Tan Valley, Queen Creek, and Gold Canyon in grades 6-12. Imagine Prep has a 100% Graduation Rate and 100% College Acceptance Rate. Imagine Prep is part of CAA Athletics.

li.a: Apply for Free and Reduced Lunch

td.div:
Imagine Prep Families,
As of Monday, March 30th, our instructional practices will need to change. Below you will see a detailed description of the types of instruction and practice that are presented to our students. We realize that there will be many “kinks” to work out the first week. We appreciate your patience and our teachers will provide flexibility to students as we begin. We are confident that once students get into a routine, they will excel in this online learning with our passionate and supportive teachers by their “virtual” side.
We understand that families may have certain constraints at home and that remote learning puts an unexpected burden on families. With that in mind, the expectation is that students will have a reasonable amount of time and workload that focuses on the most essential learning standards for progression toward the next grade level/content. Students in Odyssey courses will continue as scheduled with modifications made as needed by the teacher to help them complete their assignments within the time frame.
Each week, students will experience a similar set up for each of their content areas. Through Google Classroom, students will be presented videos of instruction, activities to practice new skills, and assignments that will be submitted for a grade. We know this is likely a source of concern and we want to make sure you understand our intent with grading is that these assignments will be used to improve a student’s grade. Along with those activities, teachers will be available virtually for Office Hours to ensure student understanding.
Descriptions of each component of our plan are outlined in the attached chart.
In our efforts to continue providing connection and normalcy to our students, we will be implementing some weekly remote fun. Each Monday morning at 8:00 am, we will post a video with the pledge of allegiance, announcements, the joke of the day, the daily weather forecast and the “Motivational Monday” quote. We will share out other remote participation activities throughout the duration of the remote learning.
We have received many questions regarding graduation, prom, and the yearbook. We sympathize with our seniors who are more deeply affected by these closures. Because the school closure has only been extended through April 10, we have not canceled the Prom Venue deposit or the Graduation venue. We will continue to monitor and should the closures extend or we receive specific guidance from local, state or federal outlets, we will update our families immediately. The yearbook is still set for production! The yearbook advisers will be reaching out to seniors regarding their pages/photos. The yearbook committee would like to request photos to include “how you are surviving social distancing” (school appropriate of course). These can be emailed to Rosalie.rollins@imagineprep.com. We will also run a contest to include the most hilarious self-created social distancing memes. More details to come.
Thank you for your continued understanding and support,
Julia Reed
Principal
